intro: Luzama indecora, commonly known as the white-flowered evergreen, is a member of the Rubiaceae family. It is native to the Andean regions of South America, particularly Ecuador and Peru. The plant is characterized by its glossy, dark green leaves and clusters of small, white flowers. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in cloud forests. Luzama indecora is valued for its ornamental appeal and is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens.
